Key Match Events: Son Heung-min scored a brace for Korea
Korea scored three goals against China for the fifth consecutive win
Kim Min-jae made proactive movements to block attacks
Lee Ki-je seemed a bit shaky at times
Jung Seung-hyun scored his first-ever goal for the national team
Pre-Game Insights: Jurgen Klinsmann did not make significant changes to the starting XI from the match against Singapore on Thursday last week
Post-Match Reflections: Korea have allowed their opponents no marks on the scoresheet while scoring 19 goals since the friendly with Wales on Sept. 8
Regular striker picks Cho Gue-sung and Hwang Ui-jo did not get on the scoresheet during Tuesday’s game, but their improvements in the recent fixtures are a bright sign for Klinsmann
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at Shenzhen Universiade Sports Centre in Shenzhen, China
Others: The team’s attack no longer seems to be an issue
Korea have four more matches in the second round of the World Cup Asian qualifiers left to play
Before Korea play the qualifier on March 21, they will head to Qatar in January for the AFC Asian Cup
